review.title: Use of Fuzzy Sets in Semantic Nets for Providing On-Line Assistance to User of Technological Systems
review.abstract: The main objective of this paper is to develop a new semantic Network structure, based on the fuzzy sets theory, used in Artificial Intelligent system in order to provide effective on-line assistance to users of new technological systems. This Semantic Networks is used to describe the knowledge of an "ideal" expert while fuzzy sets are used both to describe the approximate and uncertain knowledge of novice users who intervene to match fuzzy labels of a query with categories from an "ideal" expert. The technical system we consider is a word processor software, with Objects such as "Word" and Goals such as "Cut" or "Copy". We suggest to consider the set of the system's Goals as a set of linguistic variables to which corresponds a set of possible linguistic values based on the fuzzy set. We consider, therefore, a set of interpretation's levels for these possible values to which corresponds a set of membership functions. We also propose a method to measure the similarity degree between different fuzzy linguistic variables for the partition of the semantic network in class of similar objects to make easy the diagnosis of the user's fuzzy queries.

sections.text: The example of the technical system we are looking at here is the word processing software (Figure 1) with objects such as "string" and procedures such as "cut" or "copy." For a beginner of the software, the list of standard names is not obvious, and he often wants to ask a knowledgeable operator how to perform an action, like "rubbing letters." [4] The underlying psychological hypothesis is that targets are object properties and generators of object categories. Goals and procedures define the function of objects and the way they are used. As functional properties of objects, they enter into the construction of semantic networks as well as structural properties. We define a procedure as a sequence of operations whose execution serves to achieve a goal, and where the elements of the sequence are either primitive actions or sub-goals that require related procedures themselves.

7. Conclusion and future works
sections.text: In this thesis, we presented a new structure of the semantic network based on the theory of fuzzy sets, tested against available databases, and compared our system with neural network-based approaches and other semantic net-based techniques. Experimental results, which will be published later, have demonstrated the effectiveness of the proposed approach in providing effective online help to users of new technological systems, which can serve as a basis for our research in order to develop a general methodology for diagnosing the subject's target, applicable to a wide variety of objects, enabling the best possible approach to the category of the user's intended purpose and the best approach to diagnosis.
